greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=0. If d(n)>d(n-1), then a(n)=a(n-1)+1. If d(n)<d(n-1), then a(n)=a(n-1)-1. If d(n)=d(n-1), then a(n)=a(n-1). (d(n) is the number of divisors of n.)
comment: For n >=2, a(n) = (the number of k <= n where d(k) > d(k-1)) - (the number of k <= n where d(k) < d(k-1)).
The record values of {a(n)} occur at n= 1, 2, 4, 16, 40, 75, 165, 208,...
This sequence goes negative at n = 647. In the plot of the first 10^6 terms, the graph is mostly negative after about 250000. - _T. D. Noe_, Apr 27 2012
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
T. D. Noe, Plot of 10^6 terms
